text: When I notice emotions trying to influence my decisions, I recognize it and choose to use logic and facts instead.
During moments when I need to make important choices, I notice my state and choose to think clearly and analyze instead.
When I feel the pull to decide impulsively, I notice it and choose to pause and think ahead instead.
I let not being able to think ahead prevent me from making decisions based on long-term outcomes.
When I notice decision fatigue building, I recognize it and choose to rest and decide later instead.
I see when choices need careful analysis, and I choose to research and think before deciding instead.
When I feel the urge to let social pressure control my choices, I notice it and choose to think independently instead.
I let not identifying decision patterns prevent me from making choices based on logic and facts effectively.
When I notice myself making good decisions, I recognize it and choose to maintain those analytical patterns.
I recognize when choices come from emotion rather than logic, and I choose to analyze and think instead.
When I feel the pull to decide without considering consequences, I notice it and choose to think ahead instead.
I let problems from not thinking ahead prevent me from making decisions based on long-term outcomes.
When I notice strategic decision-making working, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I see when decisions need research, and I choose to gather facts and analyze before choosing instead.
When I feel the urge to let fatigue control my choices, I notice it and choose to rest and decide later instead.
I let not being able to analyze decisions prevent me from making choices based on logic and facts.
When I notice myself maintaining clarity in decisions, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I recognize when decisions need careful thought, and I choose to pause and analyze instead of rushing.
When I feel the pull to let impulses control my choices, I notice it and choose to think and analyze instead.
I let not identifying decision-making patterns prevent me from making choices based on long-term outcomes effectively.
